lines.content: Blossom is your personal assistant designed to help you stay organised and keeping on top of all your tasks! Whether you're a busy professional, a student juggling assignments, or anyone in between, Blossom is here to make your life easier by keeping track of your daily tasks.
Adds a todo task to the task list.
Adds a deadline to the task list.
Adds an event to the task list.
Shows all tasks in the task list.
Find tasks whose description matches the keyword.
Deletes the specified task from the task list.
- Deletes the task at the specified INDEX.
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
- The index must be a positive integer 1, 2, 3, …​
Marks the specified task in the task list as complete.
- Marks the task at the specified INDEX as complete.
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
- The index must be a positive integer 1, 2, 3, …​
Marks the specified task in the task list as incomplete.
- Marks the task at the specified INDEX as incomplete.
- The index refers to the index number shown in the displayed task list.
- The index must be a positive integer 1, 2, 3, …​
Task data are saved in the hard disk automatically after the bye command. There is no need to save manually.
* The Blossom class serves as the main class for the Blossom chatbot.
* It initialises the user interface, list of tasks, and storage components, and
* Constructs a new Blossom instance with specified storage file path.
* Initialises the Ui TaskList, and Storage components and attempts to load
* existing tasks from the text file.
* If loading fails, initialises a new empty TaskList.
* @param filePath the path to the text file where tasks are stored
* @throws RuntimeException if there is a problem initialising the storage and tasks
* Starts Blossom. Initialises the parser and begins the interaction loop.
Parser parser = new Parser(ui, tasks, storage);
* This class extends the standard {@code Exception} class and is used to indicate
* conditions that Blossom might want to catch.
* The Parser class parses user input and handles command execution.
* It reads and interprets commands from the user and executes corresponding actions
* Constructs a Parser object that handles the logic for parsing and executing commands.
* @param ui the Ui to interact with the user
* @param tasks the task list to manage tasks
* @param storage the storage to manage saving and loading tasks
Parser(Ui ui, TaskList tasks, Storage storage) {
* Starts the command processing loop which continuously reads user input and processes commands
* until the "bye" command is typed by the user.
* Executes a given command by calling the suitable methods based on the command type.
* @param command the user input command to be executed
* @return false if the command is "bye" (indicating the program should stop),
// Call the unmark and mark function
* The Storage class handles loading and saving tasks to a text file.
* It is responsible for reading and writing task data to the hard disk.
* @param filePath The path of the file where tasks are stored.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be loaded or saved.
* Loads tasks from the file specified by filePath. If the file does not exist,
* it tries to create a new file.
* @throws BlossomException if there is no file to be found.
File f = new File(this.filePath); // create a File for the given file path
System.out.println("Data file not found! Creating a new one....");
* Parses a single line from the text file and adds the corresponding task
* @param fileInput A line from the task file that stands for a single task.
* @throws BlossomException if the task type is unknown.
public void addTaskFromFile(String fileInput) throws BlossomException {
Event event = new Event(description, from, to);
throw new BlossomException("Invalid task type: " + type);
* Saves all tasks in the task list to the text file specified by filePath.
System.out.println("An error occurred while trying to save tasks to file.");
* A TaskList object corresponds to a list of tasks including
* adding, marking, unmarking, and deleting tasks.
* For all task-related operations within Blossom.
* Constructs a new TaskList along with the Ui for user interactions.
* @param ui The Ui object used for displaying information to the user.
* Retrieves the list of all tasks.
* Marks or unmarks a task based on the given action.
* @param itemIndex The index of the task to be marked or unmarked.
* @param action The action to perform ('mark' or 'unmark').
public void markAndUnmarkItem(int itemIndex, String action) {
// If this item is marked - change boolean
System.out.println("Yayy~~ Good job in getting this done!");
System.out.println("Hope you get this done soon! :D");
* Adds a new task based on the input.
* @param input The input string containing task details and type.
* @throws BlossomException if there is an error in creating the task.
public void addTask (String input) throws BlossomException {
* Creates a Task object from an input string
* @param input The input string describing the task.
* @throws BlossomException if the input format is incorrect or missing necessary data.
public Task createTask(String input) throws BlossomException {
// Split input into description and due date "by"
// Split input into description and "to" and "from" date
throw new BlossomException("Event must include both start and end times.");
throw new BlossomException("Sorry~~ idk what that means ( • ᴖ • ｡)");
* Checks for input errors such as empty or incorrect formats.
* @param input The input string to be checked.
* @throws BlossomException if checks for errors fail.
public void catchInputErrors(String input) throws BlossomException {
throw new BlossomException("Oopsie!!! (;° ロ°) The description of a task cannot be empty~~ ");
throw new BlossomException("Oopsie!!! (;° ロ°) The description of a todo cannot be empty~~ ");
throw new BlossomException("Oopsie!!! (;° ロ°) The description of a deadline cannot be empty~~ ");
throw new BlossomException("Oopsie!!! (;° ロ°) The description of an event cannot be empty~~ ");
* Deletes a task from the list based on the specified index.
* @param indexOfTask The index of the task to be removed.
System.out.println("Removing this task now! ᕙ(  •̀ ᗜ •́  )ᕗ ");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list! ૮ ˶ᵔ ᵕ ᵔ˶ ა");
* The Ui class handles all user interactions, displaying messages, tasks, and other
* Prints all tasks in the list.
* @param listOfTasks the list of tasks to be printed
System.out.println("Try hard to get these tasks done~~ ");
* Prints the starting up message to the user.
System.out.println("Your wish is my command (シ_ _ )シ");
* Prints the total number of tasks currently in the list.
* @param listOfTasks the list of tasks to count
System.out.println("Now you have " + listOfTasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Prints a goodbye message when the user exits the application.
System.out.println("Bye~~~ Come visit me soon! (๑>◡<๑)");
* Represents a deadline-type task with a specific due date.
* Extends the {@link Task} class with an additional attribute to hold the deadline date.
* Constructs a new Deadline task with the specified description and due date.
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The due date of the task.
* Sets the due date of the deadline task.
* @param by The new due date to set for the task.
* Retrieves the due date of the deadline task.
* @return The due date as a string.
* Adds prefix "D" to indicate the task type, and includes due date.
* @return The string representation of the task for file storage.
* Includes the task type, description from the superclass, and the due date.
* @return The string representation of the deadline task.
* Represents an event task with a start and end time.
* This class extends {@link Task} by adding time and date details.
* Constructs a new Event with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Retrieves the start time of the event.
* @return The start time as a string.
* Retrieves the end time of the event.
* @return The end time as a string.
* Adds prefix "E" to indicate the task type, and includes the start and end times.
* @return The file format string of the event task.
* Includes the task type, description from the superclass, and the start and end times.
* @return The string representation of the event task.
* Represents a generic task with a description and a completion status.
* This class serves as a base for more specific types of tasks such as todo, deadlines or events.
* Constructs a new Task with the specified description.
* The task is not completed when created.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns the status icon indicating whether the task is done.
* @return A string representing the status icon ("[X]" if done, "[]" if not done).
return (isDone ? "[X]" : "[]"); // mark done task with X
* Retrieves the description of the task.
* Sets the description of the task.
* @param description The new description for the task.
* Unmarks the task as not completed.
* Returns a string representation of the task for file storage,
* @return The file format string of the task.
* Represents a to-do task without any date or time constraints.
* This class extends {@link Task} with new string representations for a to-do task.
* Constructs a new Todo instance with the specified description.
* @param description The description of the to-do task.
* Includes the task type and description from the superclass
* @return The string representation of the to-do task.
* Adds prefix "T" and includes superclass file format
* @return The file format string of the to-do task.
